section.text: *NOTE: This section includes amendments by emergency legislation that will expire on February 22, 2026. To view the text of this section after the expiration of all emergency and temporary legislation, click this link: Permanent Version.*
section.heading: Establishment of the grocery access pilot grant program.

para.text: In Fiscal Years 2025 and 2026, the Department of Health shall establish a grocery access pilot grant program for the purpose of providing up to 1,000 eligible District residents with membership to a grocery delivery service at no cost for 2 years.
To be eligible to participate in the pilot program, an applicant shall:
Be a resident of the District; and
Be enrolled in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program Education ("SNAP-Ed") program.
The Department of Health shall give preference to an applicant who lives in an "eligible area" as that term is defined in § 47-3801(1D)(A).
At the conclusion of the 2-year pilot program, the Department of Health shall incorporate the data collected in the program in their SNAP-Ed program.
The data collected pursuant to subsection (c) of this section shall be made available to the Council upon request.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 5142 of Fiscal Year 2025 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2024 (D.C. Act 25-506, July 15, 2024, 71 DCR 8406).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 5162 of Fiscal Year 2026 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-146, Sept. 3, 2025, 72 DCR 9623).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 5162 of Fiscal Year 2026 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-210, Nov. 24, 2025, 0 DCR 0).
